title: Exploring Strategies and Limitations of the ARCS Motivation Model Application: Science Education Field Case-Centered

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Mobile-based short-term intensive course for pre-service and in-service teachers, incorporating digital tool utilization and project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can design more than three specific strategies to apply the four core elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) to science lessons
Learners can analyze cultural/geographical differences that may occur when applying the ARCS model and propose solutions to overcome them
Learners can submit project-based instructional designs combining the ARCS model with technologies (AI/VR) in mobile microlearning environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
